fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, we will not be able to auto scroll when moving adding a rule to certain labels in automation for Jira.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create set of labels which will go beyond the current screen.
 * When trying to move any rule to the label which is not visible on the screen with click and drag, you will not see the labels scrolling down when we reach the end of the screen. 

h3. Expected Results

When we click and drag a rule and move towards the bottom or top the labels list should scroll through so that we can place the rule in the right label. 
h3. Actual Results
h3. !Auto-scroll labels.gif|width=348,height=166!
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Auto scroll for labels in Automation for Jira

fields.description:
Currently, manual triggers can only be restricted by groups, it could be very helpful to include roles or single users to this option.
 !image-2020-10-08-14-51-51-351.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Jira Automation, add roles to the manual triggers

fields.description:
Currently, Automation for Jira has a limit when using roles, automation conditions don't support roles with more than 50 users, it would be helpful to don't have this restriction.
 !image-2020-10-08-15-04-17-914.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Automation for Jira, remove the role user limit in conditions

fields.description:
Currently, when a manual rule has an actor without permission the rule can be seen and be triggered.

It would be helpful if the rule is not visible when the users don't have the required permission.
fields.summary: Automation for Jira, hide manual rules when the user that is running it does not have permission

fields.description:
Today we only have the condition "*Contains all of*" when comparing two fields with multi values. It should be good to have the condition "*Contains NOT all of*".
 !image-2020-10-23-17-20-08-118.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add a new condition "Contains NOT all of" into the "IF" component

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Associating a Board created in a Next-Gen Project breaks the Board
h3. Steps to Reproduce

*1.* Delete a Next-Gen Project
 *2.* Attempt to open the board associated with that Next-Gen Project
 * _Doing this opens a modal, asking you to associate the board to an existing project_

*3.* In the modal, select a Classic Project
 *4.* The Next-Gen Board is now broken
h3. Expected Results
 - The Next-Gen Board is rejected, due to a mismatch in Project Type origin

h3. Actual Results
 - The Process is completed, causing the board to break

h3. Workaround
 - Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Associating a Board created in a Next-Gen Project breaks the Board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The filter suggestions drop-down is hidden behind the "filter field" on the "Workload piechart" gadget

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a  dashboard
# Add a Workload Pie chart gadget to the dashboard
# On the "Filter" field, start typing the name of a filter/project

h3. Expected Results

A list of the possible matches is displayed.

h3. Actual Results

The list is somehow "hidden" behind the gadget fields.
 !Screen Recording 2020-10-23 at 04.50 PM.gif! 

h3. Notes

- On the browser's network tab, it's possible to see a response with the filter suggestions.
- This bug affects other gadgets, such as "Time to first response" and "Average time in status".


h3. Workaround

If you enter the full name filter on the field and press enter, it will work correctly.
fields.summary: The filter selection dropdown doesn't work on some gadgets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Video attachments get narrowed when viewing on New Issue View
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attach a video to an issue
 # View the video from the new issue view and it will be narrowed "squashed"

h3. Expected Results
The video should be able to view expanded
h3. Actual Results
The video gets narrowed:

[^JRACLOUD-75382.webm]
h3. Workaround

Download the video attached and view it directly from your workstation
fields.summary: Video attachments get narrowed when viewing on New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As per [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/archive-a-project-1013843066.html], when the project is archived it possible to access issues within it using direct links.
{quote}Issues in archived projects won't appear in basic or advanced search results. You can access these issues through direct links, but you can't edit them.
{quote}
However, this doesn't work in the new issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Find a project to which you have access.
 # Open an issue (keep a note of direct issue link).
 # Go to Projects > View all projects.
 # Find your project which you choose on *step #1* and select *...*  > *Archive*.
 # Click *Archive* on the confirmation dialog box.
 # Make sure you are on 'New Issue View' and try to access the issue using a direct link (from *step #2*). It gives permission error.

!image-2020-10-23-22-22-09-061.png|width=716,height=160!

h3. Expected Results

If the user had access to the project before the project was archived they should be able to view issues using direct links.
h3. Actual Results

There is a permission error (even for project admin and Jira admin).

!image-2020-10-23-22-22-57-034.png|width=783,height=175!
h3. Workaround

Turn off [new issue view|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/turn-the-new-issue-view-on-or-off/] and then access the issue using the direct link. Issue should load correctly.
fields.summary: Unable to access issues from archive project (on new issue view)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Jira language is set to _PT-BR_ the *Parent* column is translated as *Pai* in the picker whereas it shows up as *Principal* in the column itself. *Parent Link* remains the same across languages though.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Under Jira Personal Settings change the language to *português (Brasil)*;
!step 1.png|thumbnail!
 # Open a project (happens with both Classic and Next-Gen projects) and start an _Advanced issue search_;
 # Go to the Column drop down and search for “PA”. It should return both *Parent Link* and *Pai*
 !step 2.png|thumbnail!  
 # Add both columns. The GUI will render them as *Parent Link* and *Principal*.
 !step 3.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

*Parent* should remain the same across *Picker* and *Column* presentation regardless of the language under settings.
h3. Actual Results

Actual results

In PT-BR the picker has *Parent Link* and *Pai*. In the _Presentation_ we have *Parent Link* and *Principal*, which is misleading and confusing.
h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding Parent column to a JQL search is misleading due to inconsistent translation

fields.description: *Problem description*Currently, there is no way for the user app to be notified of changes to the project workflow configuration. In particular, when the step name in the workflow configuration is changed, the information is not propagated to the application*Solution*It should be possible to register a webhook for the workflow modification event. The webhook should contain the details of changes or the current workflow definition
fields.summary: Webhooks for workflow modifications

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Groups that are synced through Azure AD cannot see confluence links in the issue view if they have view permission in the kb space granted to the synced group.

They are able to access the link but cannot see the preview receiving the "We couldn't load this page" error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Sync a group through Azure AD external directory;
 # Grant view permission for this group in the space kb permissions associated with a project;
 # Link a confluence article to an issue in this project;
 # The user won't be able to see the link, however, it's able to open it.

h3. Expected Results

The members of the group are able to see the link in the issue view.
h3. Actual Results

"We couldn't load this page" error is shown.
h3. Workaround

Add individual permission or include those users in a group that isn't synced externally and they will be able to see the link.
fields.summary: Groups synced through Azure AD can't see Confluence links in the issue view if granted group permission in the kb space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, at Next Gen project when using "Send Email" action and set the "To" as *"Approver" or "Pending Approver"* doesn't work. It doesn't capture any email.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Next-Gen JIRA Service Desk project
 # Create issue with approver.
 # Create automation with "Send Email" action.
# Set the "To" , for *Approver* and *Pending Approver*
# Execute the automation

h3. Expected Results
Email send to the approver.

h3. Actual Results
From the audit log , it hit into error :-

{noformat}
Could not send email, the 'To' address field is empty. If you have referenced a field it may be empty.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: At Next gen project , Using "Send Email" action and set the "To" as "Approver" or "Pending Approver" doesn't work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating an issue in the Project > Issues > All issues page the top right side pop-up is not always displayed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Project > Issues page.
 # Create a ticket with the "create" button at top of the screen.
 # The pop-up of with the issue key and summary should be displayed at the top right corner, but this behavior is intermittent.

h3. Expected Results

The pop-up should always appear.

h3. Actual Results

The pop-up behavior is intermittent. 

h3. Workaround

Sometimes refreshing the page will make the pop-up appear.
fields.summary: Create issue pop-up is intermittent

fields.description: This is critical and I would like to avoid having my users have to use the Create button and link the issue.
fields.summary: When Creating an issue in an Epic using the + button you should be able to select the Project same as in the legacy View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to access issues from archived projects with direct link
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Archive a Project
 # Try to access an issue from the archived Project with the direct link https://<domain>.atlassian.net/browse/<issue>

h3. Expected Results
Should be able to access the issue based on the documentation [Archive a project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/archive-a-project-1013843066.html]
h3. Actual Results
You will get a message that you do not have permissions to view the issue:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Can not access issues from archived projects

fields.description:
Currently under the people section, if we have added a group, there is no way to check on the same screen to see if a particular user is part of that group or not.

 

Request - Any feature to expand the group membership on the *same screen* would help the project lead to get better insights of who all have access to the project.
fields.summary: Groups added under people section should have a way to expand the list of users added to it
Include user groups in the webhook responses

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Error on Validator is showing the userkey instead of using display name instead from UserProfile#getDisplayName or ApplicationUser#getDisplayName for the error message in the UI

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a Permission Validator to the transition.
 # Trigger the Validator error.

h3. Expected Results

To see the error with a Display name
h3. Actual Results

Error displays the userkey instead making it illegible for users.

!Screenshot 2020-10-22 at 09.07.03.png|width=528,height=523!

 
h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

Note: screenshots are from my own instance after reproducing the error.
fields.summary: Error on Validator showing userkey

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * Create issue form doesn't refresh when the selected project is changed
 * Fields with predefined values don't update during the issue creation process - this can lead to incorrect values for fields in newly created issues
 * Jira Service Desk request types affected, but the problem is with the create issue form in Jira

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On one project, create a new Jira Service Desk request type with hidden fields that have predefined values.
 !Screenshot 2020-10-21 at 19.05.15.png|thumbnail!
 # On another project, create a new Jira Service Desk request type without any hidden fields
 !Screenshot 2020-10-21 at 19.03.26.png|thumbnail!
 # Create a new issue in Jira and ensure that the project/request type containing the hidden fields is selected !Screenshot 2020-10-21 at 19.11.14.png|thumbnail!
 # Change the project/request type to the one that _doesn't_ have the hidden fields

h3. Expected Results
 * The form refreshes and the fields are displayed in the form without any values set or the correct values set

h3. Actual Results
 * The predefined values from the other project(CLAS in this example) remain in the hidden issue fields when creating an issue. The form doesn't refresh.
 !Screenshot 2020-10-21 at 19.11.30.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
 * Change the project to the desired project, change the Type to another value, then revert back to the intended Type/request type
fields.summary: Create issue form doesn't refresh when the selected project is changed

fields.description:
I am a senior SDET, and I've been using Jira for many years. Jira tickets are fairly flexible, except that each ticket only allows one reporter & assignee. The reporter in the case of feature stories is usually the product owner, and the assignee is the dev.

It would be nice if you could acknowledge the existence of QE/QA with an optional QE assignee on tickets. Ideally these would also be visible on the ticket from the story board.

Beyond the psychological validation of actually being associated with your work, this would be really helpful to our planning & grooming processes. 

Thanks!
fields.summary: Please add a QE/QA assignee field to Jira tickets

fields.description:
Currently, the new issue view doesn't indicate which fields are required (e.g., using a red asterisk like {color:red}\*{color} or having {color:red}*(Required)*{color}).

It would be nice if something this was added to the new issue view so that users can easily see when a field is required so that they can populate the field with data before trying to proceed with the ticket.
fields.summary: Show required field indicator in new issue view

fields.description: The notifications sent out to site admins only. For instance, when a user wants to contact a site administrator, and clicks on the Contact Administrator page and leaves a note, or when a user request access to Jira/Confluence and the notification gets sent to all site administrators we would like to change that from going to all site admins, and only to a singular email address.
fields.summary: Allow one centralized email address for admin notifications

fields.description: In the Mac App's backlog view the backlog and sprint sections show tickets on a black/white background.  It would make it easier to identify the end of a sprint/backlog sections if the was a visual indication.  In the web version, there is a frame around the sprint (grey on a white background) that makes it easy to see where a sprint or backlog end/begin.
fields.summary: Backlog view in Mac App could use contrast to delineate sprints and backlog breakpoints

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Removing *jira-software-users* group from under product access(Jira Software), still allows its members to access Jira even though they are not part of any other group.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a user to the *jira-software-users* group, ensure this user is not part of any other group that would grant access to the product.
 # Remove *jira-software-users* group under product access. 

h3. Expected Results

The user should not be able to access Jira because *jira-software-users* group has been removed under product access.
h3. Actual Results

Even though the group *jira-software-users* has been removed from product access and the user is not a member of any other group that would otherwise given product access, the user can still access Jira.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Removing jira-software-users group from under product access(Jira Software), still allows its members to access Jira even though they are not part of any other group.

fields.description:
When you create a new event on Jira instance, using the generic template, and associate with a transition on the workflow, the transition trigger doesn't fire. For example, when an issue is transitioned to "In Progress" fire this *custom* event set in the workflow and created an automation rule when an issue transition to "In progress" - this rule is not triggered.
Normally, custom events are created to customize the notification of specific users during the workflow. Note that it is not possible to fire two different events in the workflow transition.

Suggestion: Find a way of considering anytime that an issue is transitioned to a certain status, trigger the rule - not depend on the fire event in the workflow *OR* create a new trigger to fire in custom events.
fields.summary: Custom event doesn't trigger a transition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Read only issue fields are displayed as "Unknown type" on custom field page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create (or install) connect addon that register [read-only issue field|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/modules/issue-field/].
 * Visit custom fields page (https://<instance-name>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewCustomFields.jspa)
 * Search for read only issue field

h3. Expected Results

Read only issue field has a valid type
h3. Actual Results

Read only issue field has "unknown type".
 !image-2020-10-21-09-06-45-156.png!

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Read-only issue fields are not displayed properly on Custom Fields page

fields.description:
A cloud site in *Standard/Premium evaluation* has the same email notifications limit as Free plan.

Ref: [Limitations in Jira Cloud Free plans, Email notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/limitations-in-jira-cloud-free-plans-979432180.html]
{quote}Jira can send a maximum of 100 emails per day on the Free plan
  
{quote}
 When a cloud site reaches the limit, the message is shown like this.
{quote}You've sent the maximum number of notifications in 12 hours for your plan. <link to plan page> Upgrade to keep collaborating with your team.
{quote}
!Jira error.PNG|thumbnail!

This message is very confusing for users who are already on Standard/Premium evaluation because they have nothing to do except expediting the end of their evaluations. 
  
 Please modify this message like this:
 "This limitation will be removed when you move to Standard/Premium (paid) plan after your evaluation period." 

Also, it's nice that Atlassian prepares the documentation explaining the limitation during the evaluation period.
fields.summary: Incorrect warning message regarding email notifications limit for evaluation users

fields.description: By now, there is only the rules that come by default in Automation for Jira. It would be nice if the users are able to add some new rules in the library.
fields.summary: Add an option to add rules into the library

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you are an Owner of a Filter and try to make changes to it, and save it, if the left-side panel is expanded it will not show the *Save* option, only *Save as*.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Filter you are the Owner
 # Expand the left-side panel
 # Make a change to the JQL query and try to save it

h3. Expected Results
You should get the option to *Save* the changes
h3. Actual Results
You will only get the Filter show *edited* and the option to *Save as*
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Hide the left side panel from the Filter screen and make the changes to the JQL Query.
fields.summary: Saving JQL filter fails when the left-side panel is expanded

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to permanently delete a project the deletion will fail without sharing in-depth details of the issue.

Some cases may be related to issues with a great number of work logs and/or comments.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Move a project to JIRA's trash can.
# Access the trash and try to permanently delete it.

h3. Expected Results
After some time the project should vanish from the trash can, meaning it was completely deleted.

h3. Actual Results
No error messages or e-mails are sent out.

h3. Workaround
No workaround for the issue at the moment.
Please engage Atlassian Support.
fields.summary: Permanently deleting project throws timeout errors

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In a date picker field, the date presented to the end user as an example, in the new issue view is based on the locale as per the end user's account and language settings. 

This however introduces ambiguity, since the new issue view can only receive the date inputs in the format: yyyy/MM/dd

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure your account to use a non-English language such as Polish/French.
 # In a date picker field such as Due Date, the example date in the UI is based on the locale only.

h3. Expected Results
The date picker should have an example in line with the format that the field can accept -- like we see in the English locale:
 !EnglishLanguage.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* Polish language: 
 !PolishLanguage.png|thumbnail! 

* French language: 
!FrenchLanguage.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Example date present in the date picker field in the new issue view is in the locale specific format

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When having multiple statuses (over 9), the scroll bar does not appear by default
As this is confusing some uses as to the available statuses, is it possible to have the scroll bar always present

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a Jira Software project configure 10 or more statuses
# Create an issue under the project
# Attempt to change the status

h3. Expected Results
Users are to be presented with a scroll bar to help understand that there are more statuses to chose from

h3. Actual Results
Scroll bar appears only if using the mouse (to scroll up and down) or arrow key on the status panel 

h3. Workaround
Use the mouse (to scroll up and down) or arrow key on the status panel
fields.summary: Scroll Bar to always present

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Validator set as comment require won't allow to change the assignee via transition screen if the comment will be empty for the first time.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a screen with assignee and comment.
 # Set this screen into a transition.
# Add a validator "*If a value for field Comment is not provided during the transition, show the following error: Comment is empty.*"
# Then, transition a ticket to this status.
# Into the transition screen, change the assignee, stay the comment empty and click to finish the transition. This action should trigger the validator message to fill out the comment.
# Keep the "new" assignee and fill out the comment.
# Finish the transition.

h3. Expected Results
The assignee should be set via the transition screen after the validation message.

h3. Actual Results
Even filling out the comment, the new assignee won't be set via transition screen.
* [Video with bug.|https://share.getcloudapp.com/2NujlPbl]

h3. Workaround
Fill out the comment into the transition screen, and then change the assignee.
fields.summary: Validator set as comment require won't allow to change the assignee via transition screen if the comment will be empty for the first time

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you use a custom field text multi-line clear value post function, the history record from the issue shows strange values like the clod ID and the custom field ID in the old issue view.

This data should not be displayed on the history content.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a text multi-line custom field
 # Add a post-function to clear the value in a transition
 # See the history record in the old issue view 

h3. Expected Results
The History record should not have any value just the clear event

h3. Actual Results
It is adding some IDs to history when seeing it in the old issue view


h3. Workaround
Use the new issue view
fields.summary: Custom field text multi-line clear value post function recording strange data in the issue history

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The webhooks relating to project archival and deletion are inadequately documented. The webhooks are described in an announcement at [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/stateful-project-in-jira-cloud-sign-up-for-feature-preview/36838,] but not in the formal API documentation.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attempt to find information about a webhooks relating to project archival and deletion events.

h3. Expected Results

Information about the the following webhooks are found:

* project_archived

* project_restored_archived

* project_soft_deleted

* project_restored_deleted
h3. Actual Results

Information about the webhook is NOT found. 
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Project archival and deletion webhooks are inadequately documented

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Assignee icon disappears from the parent of sub-task on Next-gen.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue on Next-gen
 # Create sub-tasks below this issue
 # Assign the sub-tasks to someone
 # Go to the parent
 # Refresh the page

h3. Expected Results

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! !screenshot-1.png|height=328!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Missing Assignee in the quick panel view

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to be able to disable integration apps that are not used from project settings.

For example, OpsGenie. If I don't use or disable the suggestion for new products, it would be good if the integration configuration option is removed also from project settings to avoid causing confusion between project leads.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to disable integration apps that are not used from project settings
Report/Dashboard/Gadget - list  of projects that is in sprint or not

fields.description:
I have a suggestion to optimize the display of the tabbed groupings on the right side of the screen. 
Here I have to click to see the information inside the grouping.

Here it would be great if there would be a possibility to display information in front of the tabbed groupings. i.e. a "due date" which is in the grouping together with other dates. 


*Idea:* 
You should be able to pin fields in the grouping. If the pinned fields contain data, this data will be displayed on the tabbed grouping *instead* of the field caption. 
So you could group fields and still make the content of important fields visible directly in front. This saves clicks.
fields.summary: Displayed data on the tabbed grouping instead of the field caption on the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JIRA attachment preview doesn't the annotations added in a PDF file.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attach a PDF with an annotation(comment) to an issue
 # Click on the PDF to open it in preview

h3. Expected Results

You see the pdf contents and the comments inside the PDF
h3. Actual Results

You see the PDF content and broken rendering of annotations
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
h4.
fields.summary: Annotations in PDF is not visible when previewed in JIRA

fields.description:
lookup issues function to be able to access the worklog smart value.
 From the resulting issue list, the following issue properties are available to use (custom fields aren't available):
 * {{ {{key}}}} - Returns the issue key

 * {{ {{url}}}} - Returns the issue url

 * {{{{summary}}}} - Returns the issue summary

 * {{{{assignee.displayName}}}} -  Returns the assignee

 * {{{{reporter.displayName}}}} -  Returns the reporter

 * {{{{status}} }}- Returns the status

 * {{{{issueType}}}} - Returns the issue type

 * {{{{resolution}}}} - Returns the resolution status

 * {{{{fixVersion}}}} - Returns the fix version

 * {{{{created}}}} - Returns the date the issue was created

 * {{{{updated}}}} - Returns the date the issue was updated

 * {{{{Story Points}}}} - Returns the story points for the issue (classic Jira Software)

 * {{{{Story point estimate}}}} - Returns the story points for the issue (next-gen Jira Software). Learn more about using smart values with numbers.

Refer to the article for more information: [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/automation-actions/#Automationactions-Lookupissues]
fields.summary: Lookupissues to provide worklog issue property

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the new issue view editor (e.g Description or comment field) markdown format for the blockquote with other elements does not work as expected. The bullet/number listing is shown outside the quote.

Also, the editor disables the listing icon in the menu option.
 !Disabled inside quote.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce

*Scenario 1*
 # Open any issue key in the new issue view.
 # Choose Comment/Description or any other fields with the new editor.
 # Go to the editor and click on (+) -> choose _Quote_. Or use ">" in the editor for the blockquote.
 # Use other elements inside the blockquote.
{code:java}
 > * This is test
 >  * for inside element
 >  # Also this is for the check
  > #  And this as well
 > Quote end
{code}

*Scenario 2*
 # Create a new issue.
 # Use below in the description
{code:java}
{quote} this is while create issue
# For other element
# Which does not work
* For testing
* Again
Quote end 
{quote}
{code}

h3. Expected Results

!Expected result.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

*Scenario 1*
 Elements are not processed by the editor.

!Element not working.png|thumbnail! 
 *Scenario 2*
 In the new issue view screen, other elements are shown outside the quote.
 !Element outsite blockquote.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: New issue view editor does not honour markdown format for block quotes with the other elements

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Table content in issue renders incorrectly

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue with the Description having the following wiki info
 {code}
 |test|
 |test|
 |asdasd[{color:red}test{color}|test]asdasdasd|
 |test|
 {code}
 In the old issue view, it is rendered as:
  !wiki.render1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* Like the above, a table with 1 column

h3. Actual Results
* A table with two columns (as shown below)
  !wiki.render2.png|thumbnail! 
* Sometimes when editing the table in the new issue view, the table would 'oscillate' making it difficult to edit.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Table content in issue renders incorrectly

fields.description:
When accessing the Issue Types page on your Jira, you can delete a system issue type, such as Story, Task, Epic, and so on. 

But after deleting a System Issue Type, Jira will run a job and it'll be re-created after a while automatically. 

h3. Suggestion
* Prevent System Issue Types from being deleted
* Prevent a System Issue Type from being re-created automatically
fields.summary: Jira re-creates a system issue type after deleting it

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *"Activity"* column under *"Worked on"* in the *"People"* tab is showing a limited number of characters.
 It looks like the *"Activity"* column has a limit to display 20 characters, if we an activity with more than 20 characters, the other characters are cut off.

!bug.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a comment to an issue, this comment must happen in September since this month has a large number of characters.
 # Open the worked on-page.
 ** [https://*domain*.atlassian.net/jira/people/*useraccounthash*/work|https://%2Adomain%2A.atlassian.net/jira/people/*useraccounthash*/work]

h3. Expected Results

We would see the full activity, including the days.
h3. Actual Results

The activity information is limited to the first 20 characters.
h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: The "Activity" column under "Worked on" in the "People" tab has a limit of 20 characters.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
History tab (Issue View) shows an incorrect date for Custom Date Picker or Date Fields.

When you have a different Time Zone configure to your Personal Settings screen than the one from the General Configuration screen, it reflects the date depending on the time zone that the user that performed the change but the time from the General Configuration screen.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set User *A* personal time zone to America/Mexico City
 # Set User *B* personal time zone to Europe/Warsaw
 # With user *B* modify a date field to an issue e.g. from 2020/10/14 -> 2020/10/15 and then change it vice-versa from 2020/10/15 -> 2020/10/14
 # With user *A* verify the History Tab of the issue and it will show the date based on the time zone from user *B* but it shows the correct time and dates the change was made

*User A's view*
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
*User B's view*
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Expected Results
The date from the field must reflect the correct time zone for both users
h3. Actual Results
It will change the date from the time zone of the last user that made the change

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: History tab (Issue View) shows incorrect date

fields.description:
Automation for Jira: In manual trigger changing the actor to "User who triggered the event" shows a warning about overriding the permissions but it is not clear in what situations this takes effect, could be helpful to specify the situations or document what exactly this warning means.
 !image-2020-10-16-11-32-03-011.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Automation for Jira: In manual trigger changing the actor to "User who triggered the event" shows a waring about overriding the permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A 500 error page is displayed when a user tries to delete a project role which has default users assigned.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project role in https://<INSTANCENAME>.atlassian.net/secure/project/ViewProjectRoles.jspa
# Click on *Manage Default Members* next to the name of the newly created project role
# Click on *Edit* under *Default Users*
# Search for a user under *Add user(s) to project role:* and click *Add*
# Return to the page https://<INSTANCENAME>.atlassian.net/secure/project/ViewProjectRoles.jspa
# Click on *Delete* next to the project role name
# Click on the *Delete* button

h3. Expected Results

The project role is deleted

h3. Actual Results

An error page "Something went wrong" showing a 500 appears

 !Screen Shot 2020-10-16 at 11.27.08 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Remove all the default users before deleting the project role
fields.summary: When trying to delete projects roles that have default users, a 500 error is displayed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Multiline text field gets wiped out when moving back from next-gen project 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Multiline Text Custom field (ie. Acceptance Criteria)
 # Set the renderer for that field to Wiki-Syle
 # Create an issue on a classic project and populate the field
 # Move the issue to a next gen project 
 # Move the issue from next gen back to the original project. Use the Move option from the full issue view.
 # Choose to *retain* the field value. 

 !retain.png|thumbnail!  !review.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The multi line text field value should be retained. 

h3. Actual Results

The value is wiped out. 
 !results.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

- On the classic project, set the renderer from Wiki Style to default. 
- Perform the move and the value will be retained
- Set the renderer back to Wiki Style.
fields.summary: Multiline text field gets wiped out when moving back from next-gen project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Following JQL returns not only sub-tasks: _parent IN (ISSUE-1) OR parent IS NOT EMPTY_
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run following JQL: _parent IN (ISSUE-1) OR parent IS NOT EMPTY_

h3. Expected Results

Only sub-tasks are returned.
h3. Actual Results

Search returns also issues that are not sub-tasks.
h3. Workaround

Change JQL to : _parent IN (ISSUE-1) OR parent NOT IN (EMPTY)_
fields.summary: Searching for sub-tasks using JQL search parent clause returns incorrect results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users are unable to search for epics using the epic picker field.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to any screen with Epic field picker
 # Search for an epic on the Jira system and you will get the below error {quote} !epic (1).jpg|thumbnail! {quote}

h3. Expected Results

Should be able to search for the epic in the drop down and select them.
h3. Actual Results

We get an error stating that the epic with the key is not found
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

As of now, even if the search throws an error, we are able to save the page with the epic key mentioned.
 # Type in the epic key.
 # Even if the error shows up, try to save the screen or move to the next screen and the epic key will be saved.
fields.summary: JQL search in Epic Picker times out

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Project role usage feature does not show the utilization for workflow _User in any project role_ condition.
 !Role.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Project role
 # Navigate to any workflow and click on Edit
 # Add condition in any of the transition as a _user is in any project role_
 # Choose the required project role/roles
 # Go to the Project role -> View Usage
 # It won't report this condition
 !User_Project_Role.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results
Usage report should show the Workflow and the transition name where this project role is used.
h3. Actual Results

The usage report is blank.

h3. Workaround

None as of now.
 However, if there is only 1 project to be used, then the condition _User in a project role_ could be used. This is correctly reported on the usage page.
fields.summary: View usage report of the Project role fails to report workflow condition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using %%CURRENT_DATETIME%% in post function doesn't set the correct date on Date Picker fields

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# create a customer field Auto-Due-Date as a Date Picker 
# add post function in the workflow as follows:
On the Create transition add the following Post functions:
* The Auto-Due-Date of the issue will be set to %%CURRENT_DATETIME%%.
* The field Due date will take the value from Auto-Due-Date. Source and destination issue are the same.

h3. Expected Results
The date on field Due Date and Auto-Due-Date should show the current correct date. 

Similarly, if you 
# create a custom field Auto-Date-Time as a Date Time Picker
On the Create transition add the following Post functions:
* The Auto-Date-Time of the issue will be set to %%CURRENT_DATETIME%%.
* The field Due date will take the value from Auto-Date-Time. Source and destination issue are the same.

h3. Actual Results
It is showing time in GMT for Due Date. This can be verified if you are on AEST time as an example and you create an issue prior to 11:00AM, then check the Auto-Date-Time - you will notice that the Auto-Date-Time (Date Time Picker) is actually showing correct date/time value, however when copied over to Due Date - the date is reflected in GMT

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Using %%CURRENT_DATETIME%% in post function doesn't set the correct date on Date Picker fields

fields.description:
I like the new editor in the new Jira issue view, but it's super annoying that you have to keep scrolling up and down to apply different formatting, like Header 2, then color green.

Can you make the toolbar "sticky" so it's always visible when I scroll the content?
fields.summary: Editor toolbar needs to always be visible

fields.description:
When you click on the "Create" button you still get the old editor (see screenshot):


!image-2020-10-15-17-38-24-893.png!

 

Besides not having all the features of the new editor, when you enter text with mark-up (using old style markup)  in the Description area, it won't carry over correctly to the new editor when you later on view and edit the ticket.
fields.summary: Enable the new editor when creating a new issue
Improve Users Pagination under People settings

fields.description: Be able to customize the left-sidebar options so a user can not only add but also remove options that are not being used.
fields.summary: Availability to edit left-sidebar options from Projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You can add a property to a status in a workflow when issues are in that status, users associated to specific project roles cannot edit the issue.

The format is described below:
* *Property Key:* jira.permission.edit.denied.projectrole	
* *Property Value:* <id of the project role>

Currently, adding that property along with the id of any project role seems to be restricting the issue edition to all users in the instance, be they associated to that project role or not.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* In a workflow, select a status -> click on *Properties*:
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-15 at 13.42.31.png|thumbnail! 
* Add the values in the format as previously described, then publish the workflow:
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-15 at 13.43.36.png|thumbnail! 

You can get the id of a project role by hovering over the *Edit* button in the Project roles section of your instance:
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-12 at 10.50.36.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

Only users associated to that project role within the project will lose the ability to edit the issue in the status where the property has been added.

h3. Actual Results

Everyone loses the ability to edit the issue when the issue is on that status despite not being associated to that project role in the project.

h3. Workaround

If you still need to restrict issue edition in specific statuses, you can try the property *jira.permission.edit.projectrole*. 

Instead of denying the permission to a role, you will grant the permissions to the roles you want to be able to edit the issue.

You can create multiple keys of the same property by adding an unique identifier to it:
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-15 at 14.06.36.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Workflow property edit.deny.projectrole removes the permission from all users

fields.description:
h3. Issue

When we create a Scrum board (different location) including multiple projects along with next-gen, only next-gen issues do not show Story Points estimate field value in the Backlog view but classic project issues story points do show up in the backlog view.

- *Point to Note*:- With the same filter Kanban board displays Story Points for next-gen issues as well. Even though we add both *Story Points* and *Story point estimate* field in the Card layout, the Scrum board does not display the story points for next-gen issues in the backlog view

h3. Expected Behaviour: - Please add the *Story point estimate* field value for next-gen issues in Scrum boards as well
fields.summary: Story Points estimate field value does not show up in Backlog view in Scrum board filter with Next-gen & Classic projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Most Issue actions keyboard shortcuts do not work with the new Issue view in the Issue navigator in the list view.

This includes the essentials:
* *l*: Label issue
* *i*: Assign to me
* *a*: Assign issue
* *m*: Comment on issue
* *e*: Edit issue

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Enable *New Jira issue view* in your Personal settings
# In the Issue navigator, switch to a list view (keyboard shortcut "t")
# Click on an issue to highlight it and hit "l" on your keyboard

h3. Expected Results

This should trigger the *Label issue* function
 !2020-10-15_16-15-26.gif|width=400&height=200!

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior other than disabling the *New Jira issue view*. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Shortcuts no longer work in the Issue navigator for list view in the new view

fields.description:
Someone installed various add-ons (Zoom, PagerDuty, etc.) for the Jira Service Desk project and we have to see them on every single issue in our software development project. For other fields we can select to hide them, but not these ones. This is very annoying and doesn't work for companies that install a lot of add-ons for very specific needs as it pollutes ALL projects.

!image-2020-10-15-08-47-53-448.png!

Please let us hide these fields, or make the add-ons project-specific.
fields.summary: Let us disable add-on fields in my project

fields.description:
Left-aligned labels degrades usability because of the increasing horizontal eye movements.

!image-2020-10-15-09-53-49-688.png!

Right-aligned labels will be more user-friendly.

!image-2020-10-15-09-00-31-242.png!
fields.summary: Field names should be right-aligned in the issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The customer is having an issue where the Watcher's count shows an incorrect number of watchers in the new issue view. This issue is triggered when post-functions are processed by JMWE add-on.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the JMWE add-on from https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.innovalog.jmwe.jira-misc-workflow-extensions;
 # Once the add-on is installed, Create a Set Field Value (JMWE App) post function as seen here: 
    !post_func_2.png|thumbnail!
 # Create Issue 
Check watchers count
 # Current Results:
Watchers count is 2
 # Expected results
Watchers count to be 5

Note:
When clicking the watcher's count it is now reflected correctly.

h3. Expected Results

In the new issue view, when opening Jira issues and checking the watcher's count, the watcher's count should show the correct watchers' count based on the watcher's listed.
h3. Actual Results

The watcher's count shows a number that doesn't reflect the correct count. When the user clicks on *watcher's count* the number will be automatically updated to the correct count and the correct watchers will be listed. The issue only happens in the new issue view. 

h3. Workaround

The workaround, for now, is to use the old issue view to have the correct Watcher's count.
fields.summary: Watcher's count shows incorrect number of watchers in the new issue view
Support additional functions for smart value {{lookupIssues}}

fields.description:
When you add a watcher in the old issue view, it is only necessary *one* click to find the user:

!Old issue view.gif|width=716,height=386!

Different from the new issue view, that it is necessary *two* clicks:

*!image-2020-10-14-16-43-10-086.png|width=844,height=377!*

*Suggestion:* when clicking on the watcher icon the cursor should already be available to look for a user (not necessary to click "+add watchers")
fields.summary: More clicks to add watchers comparing to the old issue view

fields.description:
For some use cases, it is better to not double space the paragraph when hitting "enter":
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-14 at 16.27.55.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Double space on issue comments

fields.description:
Original title: Keyboard shortcut workflow screen

 

It would be great if the shortcut "command + enter"(MAC) / "Ctrl + enter"(Windows) transition the issue when there is a screen associated. 
 Example:
 * When hitting "command + enter"(MAC) / "Ctrl + enter"(Windows) it will move to done status;
 !image-2020-10-14-16-18-05-395.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Submit a transition screen with CMD/CTRL + enter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Inserting a table in a numbered list in an issue description breaks up the continuity of numbering

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Begin a numbered list in a Jira issue description
 # Insert a table within an item
 # Attempt to continue the numbered list

h3. Expected Results

The numbering continues after the table.

h3. Actual Results

The numbering restarts at 1.

h3. Workaround

A possible workaround would be to manually override the formatting, but this isn't ideal.
fields.summary: Inserting a Table in a Numbered List Breaks Up Numbering

fields.description:
When in the backlog in "Project A" and creating an issue in an epic in "Project A": 

The default "Project" should be the project you are already in and intending to create the story in (Project A in this example). 

I create stories in multiple boards and it is confusing when I'm in one board and trying to create a story on that board, but the default "Project" is another board. 

*Acceptance*: 
When creating a story in a project, the default "Project" for that story will be the board the user is currently working in (where they clicked "Create Issue")
fields.summary: Default Project should = Current Project when Creating Issue

fields.description:
It is not possible to insert a smart value to copy the fix versions from other issues. For example:
Copy the addition or removal of a version from subtask to parent.
* Parent has versions 1, 2, and 3
* Child has version 2
* Then user removes version 2 from child > the parent should have version 2 removed
* Then user adds version 4 to child > the parent should have version 4 added
The closest way to achieve the example below: 
!image-2020-10-14-11-34-53-384.png|thumbnail! 
The smart value {{{{lookupIssues.fixVersions.name}}}} returns the fix versions from all subtasks: [1, 2, 3], [1, 2, 3] - not accepted format.
fields.summary: Fix version field smart value format

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, all the available icon in Priority is a arrow type symbol. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be best if Atlassian provide a symbol that have "P1" , "P2" , "P3" or "P4" text.

h3. Why this is important
It's clear to users which issue priority based on the symbol text.
fields.summary: Add a new priority symbol with "P1" , "P2" , "P3" or "P4" text

fields.description:
At the moment it is not possible to change the position of fields for example Reporter or Issue link etc from the right side of the screen to the top left side of the screen.

It will be nice to able to position the field anywhere I wish on the screen.
fields.summary: Ability to customise fields position on issue view screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The issue color custom field holds the Epic color. However, in the bulk edit, this field can't be updated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new next-gen project.
 # Create an Epic.
 # Go to issue navigator and choose bulk edit.
 # In the _Edit_ screen, this field can't be updated.
 !Bulk Edit Nextgen.png! 

h3. Expected Results
As the next-gen project does not have Epic color, the custom field Issue-color should be editable.

h3. Actual Results
The field is noneditable.

h3. Workaround
Change the color from the edit/view screen.
fields.summary: Issue color is non editable in bulk update screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira app for Mac does not resolve the login process in macOS BiG Sur

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Have macOS upgraded to Big Sur and try access the Jira app for Mac

h3. Expected Results
The app should login without issues

h3. Actual Results
the login screen is not reachable, it goes into a loop to the main screen when hit the button "LogIn,...

h3. Workaround
-Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available. But avoid upgrading macOS to Big Sur while a fix is not deployed.-
Doing SMC reset help fix this issue. Users are able to login to Jira after it. See https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT201295 for instructions on how to reset SMC on Intel-based Macs.
fields.summary: Jira app for Mac does not resolve the login process in macOS Big Sur

fields.description:
By now, only open issues are shown as suggestion when linking issues. Although it's possible to link issues if the user selects the "exact key" option, it would be good to have the possibility to also see Closed issues as option.

[https://share.getcloudapp.com/2Nujy2jK]
fields.summary: Closed Issues should be also shown as suggestion to link issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Following the dropbox integration – [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Marketplace-Apps-Integrations/Introducing-Smart-Links-for-Dropbox-in-Jira-Cloud-and-Confluence/ba-p/1386971] – a file which which has been shared with a team only, cannot be linked within Jira as it returns *Can't find link*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try to link a file which is restricted to your dropbox business team
 # This would result in a *Cant find link* error message.

h3. Expected Results

The link to the file should be visible without any errors.
h3. Actual Results

Instead it returns *Can't find link* error.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cannot link a file which has been shared with a team only within your Dropbox

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users with *Administer Jira* global permission are unable to view the navigation bar on the Project Settings for Private next-gen projects that they are not a part of.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

#Step 1: As an *Administer Jira* try to access the project settings for a private next-gen project.
 #Step 2: Admins can see the project details page but cannot see the navigation bar to navigate to other pages.
h3. Expected Results

A Site admin should be able to access the project settings for private next-gen projects to manage the project and users.
h3. Actual Results

Jira Admins cannot see the navigation bar to navigate to different settings 
h3. Workaround

Add yourself as an Administrator to the private next-gen project
 Or Access the pages for the project directly by accessing the URLs:
||Project Setting||URL||
|*Project Details*|https://*<InstanceName.atlassian.net>*/jira/software/projects/*<ProjectKey>*/settings/details|
|*Access*|https://*<InstanceName.atlassian.net>*/jira/software/projects/*<ProjectKey>*/settings/access|
|*Issue Types*|https://*<InstanceName.atlassian.net>*/jira/software/projects/*<ProjectKey>*/settings/issuetypes|
|*Notifications*|https://*<InstanceName.atlassian.net>*/jira/software/projects/*<ProjectKey>*/settings/notifications|
|*Features*|https://*<InstanceName.atlassian.net>*/jira/software/projects/*<ProjectKey>*/settings/features|
|*Apps*|https://*<InstanceName.atlassian.net>*/jira/software/projects/*<ProjectKey>*/settings/app-fields|

*Replace:*

*<InstanceName.atlassian.net>* with your instance URL.
 *<ProjectKey>* with the project key for the project, you want to access.
fields.summary: Jira Admins are unable to view the navigation bar on the Project Settings for Private next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Jira does not process an incoming email it does not bounce the email back!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure the incoming mail handler to create/add a comment to issue
 ** Do not set a default reporter.
 ** Set create user to False

 # Send an email to the mail handler's email address from a user(not in the cloud instance) with an issue-key in the subject

h3. Expected Results

The email should be bounced back, possibly with an appropriate error/failure message!
h3. Actual Results

The incoming email is not processed and silently ignored(not bounced back)
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira does not bounce back emails that are not processed by incoming mail handlers which uses Default mail server

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 

When using "Field required validator" in the workflow and if the field is not updated, Jira cloud app do not display the valid error message stating "Field <fieldname> is required" instead displays as "Bad request retry"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ensure to have a workflow with a "Field required validator" on a transition.
 # Open your Jira cloud app in android phone. 
 # Transition the issue from status 1 to status 2 where you have the field required validator present.
 # if the field is not updated the transition will not take place and there will no error message. (User will also not know that it is a required field because there is no * or (required) is displayed on the screen.

I have recorded the behaviour below :

  !Mandatory_field_Validator.gif|width=146,height=317!
h3. Expected Results

!image-2020-10-13-18-04-15-388.png|width=247,height=76!
h3. Actual Results

Bad request Retry
h3. Workaround

Make the field required from the field configuration and not in the workflow.
fields.summary: No valid error message on the 'field required' to update displayed when issue transition in Jira cloud app.

fields.description: The customer would just like the popup displaying the issue in front of the kanban board to be large enough to handle the new right column width without shrinking the left part. Please make the popup wider to handle your recent change properly.
fields.summary: Larger issue view pop-up

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Duplicate comments are intermittently added to Jira issues without a clear cause. The duplication can happen immediately after the original comment is created, up to a few hours after that. This can happen when comments are added from the customer portal or when they are added from the agent view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

It has not been possible to reliably replicate the issue.
h3. Expected Results

Duplicate comments are not added.
h3. Actual Results

Duplicate comments are intermittently added to Jira issues.
h3. Workaround

While there is no single workaround to avoid duplicate comments, there are some steps that can be taken to limit the potential causes of the duplications:
 * Review any automation rules for unintended configurations that could cause duplicate comments.
 * Make sure you are using a [supported browser|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/supported-browsers-744721663.html].
 * Check if your browser has plugins/user-scripts installed that can interfere with Jira or form fields in general.
 * Verify if your network has any proxies configured that might be replaying the requests to Jira. If a proxy is configured, consider allowing your Atlassian Cloud site to bypass the proxy.
fields.summary: Duplicate comments are intermittently added to Jira issues

fields.description: Provide support for Wiki markup in the project description field. At the moment, data added in the description shows as normal text.
fields.summary: Support Wiki markup in project description

fields.description: It would be good to see the dynamic updates on the dashboard on the classic roadmap feature with a gadget.
fields.summary: Gadget for classic roadmap in dashboards

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When entering a date manually in a date picker field, the date does get highlighted on the calendar dropdown. It however does not get saved.
It is required that you click on the date in the calendar dropdown for the field to show that value.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a date picker field, such as Due Date
 # Enter the date *manually*, example 2020/10/14. 
!Screenshot 2020-10-12 at 11.41.00 AM.png|thumbnail! 
 # The date does get selected but when you hit enter the date is lost

h3. Expected Results
The selected date would get updated in the field.

h3. Actual Results
The date does not get selected and the field stays empty until you click on the date.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Manually entering a date on a custom date picker does not work

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Have Project A with one issue on it (A-1)
# Have Project B 
# Set A-1 to Done (make the Resolution Done)
# On B workflow, set post-function to Clear Resolution on To-Do status e.g..
# Move A-1 (Done) to B (To Do)

*Expected Results:*
# The issue would go through the transition on the To-Do status and the post-function would be fired.

*Actual Results:*
Nothing happens. There is no history of this ticket going through any transition. No post-functions are fired.
fields.summary: Move Issue does not perform a transition issue

fields.description:
The [Smart values - general|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/smart-values-general/] product document says, _{{issue.[Custom Field].name}}_ returns the visible label displayed on the left of the field.

 !Screen Shot 2020-10-12 at 12.18.11 pm.png|thumbnail! 

However, using this property on a custom field doesn't return the name of the custom field.

Please update the document or fix if it a bug.
fields.summary: Improve Automation for Jira Documentation for {{issue.[Custom Field]}} Available properties

fields.description:
After moving the project to trash, If we try to create a new project using the same key, we will get the below error "A project with this name already exists"

It would be user-friendly if we make the message more descriptive so that users can easily check the Trash and understand the root cause.
fields.summary: Make "A project with this name already exists" message more descriptive

fields.description:
Currently, it's not possible to log time via bulk operations.
It would be nice to have such ability.
fields.summary: Ability to log time to issues in bulk

fields.description:
Availability to customize base Reports and not just pull the data from the filter configure in the Board, as a Board is to view and manage daily activities and track the progress of each issue.

The Reports should pull the information that we need for meetings, tracking progress by user, by sprints, by groups, etc.
fields.summary: Availability to customize base Reports and not just pull the data from the filter configure in the Board

fields.description:
Currently, the default filter for the releases page is set to *Unreleased*. Though it can be changed to include *released* and *archived* filters, but these changed filter choices are not retained on a page refresh or next visit and the filter returns to the *Unreleased* only.

The suggestion is to provide the project admins the ability to save these filters permanently.
fields.summary: The default filter for the releases page should be configurable

fields.description:
The description field when creating or editing a Release is only a single line.  While you can type a longer description in the narrow box, it is annoying to do so.  Please change the description field to a multiline box.

Navigate to: *Project* > *Releases* > *Create* (or *Edit*)
fields.summary: Description field in Create/Edit Releases needs to be multi-line.

fields.description:
We have been in contact with the Atlassian Jira Cloud Mobile team in recent weeks rolling out support for our application in iOS and MacOS.

One area of improvement we would like to see is support for dark mode. When an end user selects dark mode it requires us to make some adjustments to how we display (screen, app icon, etc). 

We like the idea of having a {{AP.jira.isDarkMode}} to allow for advanced features in the descriptor so that we can show various icons in normal and dark mode. Right now we have no way to manage this.
fields.summary: Support for AP.jira.isDarkMode in Jira Cloud Mobile

fields.description:
When using Jira Cloud for Mac, Scrum and Kanban boards of next-gen or classic projects don't show the priority icon.

Although it's not possible to customize the cards for next-gen, the priority icon is shown on the web version and also on the backlog on the App.

It would be great if we could see the same fields on the cards when using the App as we see on the Web version.
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 16 Nov 2021}
Hi Everyone, 

We now support priority icons on both scrum and kanban boards. 

If you are having trouble with this or have any feedback please reach out!

Cheers,

Jack Curtis

Product Manager 
{panel}
fields.summary: Show priority icon on cards when using Jira Cloud for Mac

fields.description: It would be nice to have Burndown and other reports in iOS/Mac apps.
fields.summary: Burndown charts for Classic projects in iOS/Mac apps

fields.description:
Would be nice to see support for the Jira macOS client so we can file bugs against it here. 

Added bonus points would be to let the macOS client track public bugs filed against that client.
fields.summary: Create project for Jira macOS Client on support.atlassian.com

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When transitioning an issue using the jira mobile app, the attachment field is not present during the transitioning.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In the workflow, select a screen
# Make sure the attachment field is on the screen
# Head over to the jira mobile app and go to any issue the workflow is in
# Transition an issue and the field attachment will not be in.

h3. Expected Results
The attachment field should appear on the transition screen

h3. Actual Results
The attachment field does not appear

h3.Workaround
The only way to upload attachment is to head over to an issue and upload an attachment by tapping on the paper clip icon.
fields.summary: Attachment field not appearing in transition screens in Mobile App

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Project picker field not available in the issue screens in Mobile device
h3. Environment
Jira Cloud app.
Affects both iOS and Android devices.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Project picker field in one of the Transition screens of the project.
Transition an issue ( using the Mobile device)
Observe that the project picket field is missing

The field is available in the browser, both Mobile and Computer.

h3. Expected Results
The project picker field is displayed on the transition screen and allows to select of the project from the drop-down.

h3. Actual Results
The project picker field is not available on the transition screen.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Project picker field not available in the issue screens in Mobile device

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For IOS users, whenever there is no field on the transition screen and there is a validation for comments during the transition, a pop up with the comment validation message will be shown on the mobile screen.


For Android users, the popup message is not shown. Instead, it goes directly to the comment section during the transition.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a transition screen with no fields and attach it to a workflow transition. In the screenshots, I have put this in the All - > Done transition.
 # Create a validation for comment validation during the transition. For example -If a value for field Comment is not provided during the transition, show the following error: No comments.
 # Log in to an IOS device and execute the transition. A pop up will be shown with "No comments" instead of directly going to the comment section.

h3. Expected Results

During the transition, the screen should directly go to the comment section as in Android.
h3. Actual Results

A popup will be shown with the message configured in the comment validation instead of going to the comment section.
{noformat}
NA{noformat}
h3. Workaround

NA
fields.summary: In IOS, doing an issue transition when there is no fields in transition screen and there is a comment validation during transition, message popup will come instead of going to comment screen directly.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira mobile app sends push notifications to users even if the project notification scheme has said notification disabled.

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud
* Android
* iOS

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Jira Project
# Remove all notifications from the project configuration
# Acess assign issue to a user who uses the mobile app

h3. Expected Results
* user does not receive any notification

h3. Actual Results
* User receives a push notification
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
* Disable mobile notifications on the app on a users basis.
fields.summary: Mobile app push notifications not respecting project configuration
